title: Is there any difference between Tablet PC and Tablet? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, that depends on what you mean by tablet. In your question, you cite both tablet PCs and tablets. Both are tablets, but both are not PCs, which sounds like a logic puzzle. Generally, a tablet (sans PC) is a device that has a touchscreen for interaction, no keyboard, and runs a mobile OS like iOS or Android. There have been a smattering of Linux-based tablets, and Microsoft floated the miserable Windows RT for a bit, but that’s pretty much it. A tablet PC, on the other hand, is a tablet that runs a non-mobile OS, like Windows. There have been precious few Mac OS tablets, and they were very costly converted MacBooks, so those don’t really count, which leaves just Windows. While a tablet PC lacks a keyboard, it’s quite rare that they don’t have a keyboard as an option or a bundled component. So, yes. There IS a difference, though that line is starting to blur. Mobile OS apps are maturing, online services have become far more prevalent, and Microsoft has been hammering away at stuff for a while now, like the Surface Pro and Surface Book. Tablets are also taking a dive in the market, as more and more people use their phones instead. And, of course, Microsoft has recently highlighted PC makers who have started announcing Windows devices that run Windows 10 on ARM processors, which is a strong him that MS will be rejoining the mobile market with a device that can not only work as a phone, but as a real PC. Times sure as hell are interesting.

Here we are giving you brief difference between Tablet PC and the Tablet. Here's been a massive rise in the number of tablet-like devices on the market. From afar, they all look like thin, handheld computer screens, but there are major differences between them. The easiest way to find out which is which is to see if it's considered an eReader, tablet, or a tablet PC. & we are here also shows you the best Tablet PC for you so you can buy that also. Tablet PCs: The most robust of the three, a tablet PC packs the power and punch of a notebook computer. In fact, it's often a fully functional notebook with the ability of turning into a tablet. This can be accomplished by flipping over the screen or sliding back the keyboard. Or Tablets: More multifunctional than an eReader, a tablet is used for browsing multimedia content. It usually has a color touchscreen with a wide selection of apps, turning it into a multipurpose tool for games or movies. Often, this easy-to-use device can download eReader apps, though the lack of an eInk screen makes it slightly less comfortable for long reading sessions. The lines between electronics is blurrier than ever. A phone can be a tablet and a tablet a phone. In such a scenario there is no clear line that separates one gadget from another in terms of what it can be categorised as. A tablet could be something that has a touch screen as its primary input and has a large screen just for that. Add a keyboard and a mouse to that and it becomes a table PC since keyboard and mouse are often associated with PCs.

A tablet computer, however, is a computer that is still smaller and has better portability but fewer features and/or options. It has a touch screen display and its battery, display and circuitry is in a single unit. ... In tablets the battery lasts for a long period of time but the battery of laptop will last lesser
